remarks: This lemma is used to prove the existence of a function p_t as in the beginning of Lemma 1 [BrosowskiDeutsh] p. 90: for all t in T - U, there exists a function p in the subalgebra, such that p_t ( t_0 ) = 0 , p_t ( t ) > 0, and 0 <= p_t <= 1.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:

stoweidlem23.7 $e |- ( ph -> S e. T ) $.
stoweidlem23.8 $e |- ( ph -> Z e. T ) $.

stoweidlem23 $p |- ( ph -> ( H e. A /\ ( H ` S ) =/= ( H ` Z ) /\ ( H ` Z ) = 0 ) ) $.
